hint_auto_confirm.message: Follow the link if it was confirmed

desc_for_command_interval.message: This option value is the time till a command is confirmed. It is available only if there aren't a confirmed command when you typed keys.

desc_for_amount_of_scrolling.message: This is used when scrollDown and scrollUp is called.

desc_for_key_algorithm.message:
Select an algorithm that generates hint keys in the hint mode.
1. Standard
Characters used as hint keys in this algorithm is jfhkgyuiopqwertnmzxcvblasd. Hint keys in the hint mode are generated by fetching a character from it.
2. Comfortable
This algorithm tries to generate hint keys as possible as type with only one hand. In most case, this is usable more than Standard Algorithm.
3. Custom
Specify hint keys by yourself. You must at least specify two keys.

desc_for_letter_type.message:
Select an hint letter type.
1. lowercase
Hint keys generated by the algorithm is converted to lowercase
2. UPPERCASE
Hint keys generated by the algorithm is converted to UPPERCASE

desc_for_hint_auto_confirm.message: If this option is available, if there is only one element when you search with text in the hint mode, the element will be clicked and move to a next page.

desc_for_ignore_urls.message: You can specify url at each lines using regular expression to make Hometype unavailable.

desc_for_key_bindings.message:
You can customize key bindings to specify following format:
map-type assigned-keys executed-commands [--options]
For example,
nmap j scrollDown
vmap <C-c> enterNormalMode
imap Jf scrollDown followLink
map-type
You can specify nmap, cmap, imap, vmap, fmap. Each types correspond to key bindings in the normal mode, command mode, insert mode, visual mode, hint mode.
assigned-keys
You can specify keys to invoke a command you want to execute. Multi keys is available.
executed-commands
You can specify commands you want to executed with its options. Multi commands also is available. If you give @ character to the head of the command, Hometype takes over its options that was executed previous when the command will be executed.
To get more information for commands please see Hometype command reference
